From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Occitan luchar, from Latin luctārī. Compare French lutter.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Languedoc):(file)

Verb

[edit]

luchar

  1. to combat; to battle

Conjugation

[edit]

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin luctārī. Compare Portuguese lutar, French lutter

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /luˈt͡ʃaɾ/ [luˈt͡ʃaɾ]
  • Audio (Peru):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: lu‧char

Verb

[edit]

luchar (first-person singular present lucho, first-person singular preterite luché, past participle luchado)

  1. to fight, to battle, to do battle
    Synonyms: pelear, lidiar
    luchar por sobrevivir ― to fight to survive
  2. to struggle, to strive, to contend, to grapple
  3. (sports) to wrestle

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of luchar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund luchando
past participle masculine feminine
singular luchado luchada
plural luchados luchadas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
